headline: Opinion: J.D. Vance is the only candidate addressing opioid crisis
author: Nancy Nix
sentences:
Opinion contributor
In the past two years, I have lost more close friends and family members to drug overdoses than to COVID-19, including two of my first cousins and a very young, vibrant family friend.
Better policy depends on better politicians, and 2022 is a chance to remedy the decades of corporate and political negligence that is killing families and children and decimating communities.
If we lived in normal times, passing the torrid benchmark of 100,000 yearly overdose deaths would be the story of the year.
More importantly, we need leaders in Washington who know that fixing this crisis means giving Ohioans a second chance.
But we don’t live in normal times – it is not normal for nearly 5,000 Ohioans to die of overdose each year.
We need leaders committed to securing the border and enforcing our laws.
Nancy Nix is a certified public accountant and Butler County treasurer.
It doesn’t have to be this way, and U.S. Senate candidate J.D.
Rob Portman willing to address the opioid crisis head-on.
Vance’s life story is a testament to second chances.
Vance is the only candidate running to succeed Sen.
He’ll be a senator who knows what that means.
To this Ohioan, that means quite a lot.
Vance is the only one saying so.
